# Basic Skills’ Workshop – Dorchester Penitentiary

## Notice Details
- **Reference Number**: 21208-24-4441679/A
- **Public notice date**: 2023-11-17 is not applicable.
- **Closing date and time**: 2023-12-04 T13:00:00 EST
- **Contract authority**: Jolaine Amos
- **Contractor contact information**: jolaine.amos@csc-scc.gc.ca or 506-269-3787

## Contract Details
- **Contract description**: Basic Skills’ Workshop – Dorchester Penitentiary
- **Solicitation type**: Request for Proposal (RFP)
- **Competition type**: Open bidding
- **Evaluation criteria**: Lowest cost per point
- **Contract duration**: January 1, 2024 to December 31, 2024, with the option to renew for two (2) additional one-year periods
- **Estimated quantity of commodity**: see solicitation document statement of work and basis of payment

## Background and objectives
The Correctional Service of Canada (CSC) requires the provision of educational services to inmates with learning difficulties residing at Dorchester Penitentiary, and the Shepody Healing Centre, through the Basic Skills’ Education Workshop.

The CSC aims to increase educational skill levels among inmates, in keeping with Commissioner’s Directive 720 (Education Programs and Services for Offenders. The delivery of educational services will be tailored to meet the needs of various inmate groups, including Indigenous inmates, inmates requiring mental health care, and others.

## Requirements
The Service Provider will be required to deliver the following:
- A Basic Skills' Education Workshop Teacher/Instructor, who will provide teaching services to inmates with learning challenges and difficulties, for 35 hours per week.
- Adult Basic Education programs (ABE).
- Adapted Adult Basic Education programs.
- Other education programs, pilot programs, digital education, and any other curriculum requested by the Project Authority.
- Provide appropriate provincially recognized certificates, following course and level completions.

## Procedure
To participate in this procurement opportunity, all interested services providers should contact the Contracting Authority to obtain a copy of the RFP document and requirements. Bidders can also request a debriefing on the results of the bid solicitation process after contract award.

- The Crown reserves the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement.
